meanings.definition: Having an excess of alkali or base.
meanings.sent1: The alkalotic solution turned the litmus paper blue.
meanings.sent2: The soap was alkalotic, making it effective for cleaning grease.
meanings.sent3: The alkalotic soil made the plants grow taller than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her alkalotic personality always brought a sense of calm to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The alkalotic taste of the water reminded him of his childhood by the ocean.

meanings.sent1: The alkalotic medication helped balance the pH levels in his body.
meanings.sent2: The alkalotic diet was recommended to treat his condition.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the alkalotic drink made her feel like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: His alkalotic behavior in stressful situations surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The alkalotic effect of the music lifted his spirits instantly.
